name: Distraction Shield/background.js
isInterceptionOn
description:
Unfortunately webrequestlisteners are not able to process asynchronous functions.
Therefore we need a global variable to keep track of the state of the extension.

name: initBackground
description: inits the background by setting the listener to the {@link BlockedSiteList}

name: replaceListener
description:
This function updates the webrequestlistener by passing a {@link BlockedSiteList} to it. From this list, the active urls
are taken. If the {@link UserSettings}  is on and there are active urls, a new webrequestlistener is added which intercepts
the active urls.

params.name: blockedSiteList
params.description: {BlockedSiteList} the new list of BlockedSites

name: addWebRequestListener
description: Adds a listener to the onBeforeRequest which blocks all requests to the urls in the urlList

params.name: urlList
params.description: {Array} the active urls to be intercepted

name: removeWebRequestListener
description: Clears the onBeforeRequest listener. Used to turn the extension off & to update the listener with a new listener.

name: intercept
description:
function that does everything that should happen when we decide to intercept the current request.
Incrementing counters and modifying url's

params.name: details
params.description: details about the current webrequest

name: handleInterception
description:
Function which fires when we enter a website on the blockedsite list.
If we come from zeeguu and have completed an exercise than we may continue, else we redirect.

params.name: details
params.description: the details found by the onWebRequestListener about the current webRequest

name: turnOffInterception
description:
turns off interception from the background by setting {@link isInterceptionOn} to false and by retrieving
the {@link UserSettings}  from {@link storage} and triggering the turnOffFor function

name: Distraction Shield/classes/BlockedSite.js
constructor
description: Basic datatype of the extension. One BlockedSite instance represents one website that the user wants to block.

params.name: urlBase
params.description: Domain of the BlockedSite

params.name: title
params.description: Title of the BlockedSite

name: constructUrl
description: returns url regex

params.name: blockedSite
params.description: BlockedSite to serialize

name: parseBlockedSite
description: Parses the JSON object to a BlockedSite object

params.name: blockedSite
params.description: BlockedSite to parse

name: deserializeBlockedSite
description: This parses a JSON string to a BlockedSite Object

params.name: serializedBlockedSite
params.description: {string} JSON string containing the BlockedSite

name: Distraction Shield/classes/BlockedSiteList.js
addToList
description: Adds the BlockedSite if this doesn't exist in the list yet.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Returns true if added to the list

params.name: newBlockedSite
params.description: {BlockedSite} {@link BlockedSite} to be added

return.description: Returns true if added to the list

name: addAllToList
description: Adds all BlockedSites to the list

params.name: blockedSiteList
params.description: {BlockedSiteList} {@link BlockedSite} to be added

name: removeFromList
description: removes BlockedSite from the list

params.name: blockedSiteToDelete
params.description: {BlockedSite}

name: updateInList
description: Takes a BlockedSite and updates the corresponding match in the BlockedSiteList

params.name: blockedSite
params.description: {BlockedSite} BlockedSite to update

name: filterOnChecked
description: Filters BlockedSiteList based on checkboxVal of {@link BlockedSite}

params.name: blockedSiteList
params.description: BlockedSiteList to serialize

name: parseBlockedSiteList
description: Parses the JSON blockedSiteList to a BlockedSiteList object

params.name: blockedSiteList
params.description: BlockedSiteList to parse

name: deserializeBlockedSiteList
description: This parses a JSON string to a BlockedSiteList Object

params.name: serializedBlockedSiteList
params.description: {string} JSON string containing the BlockedSiteList

name: Distraction Shield/classes/UserSettings.js
constructor
description:
This object holds all the data that is connected to the user's preferences.
Furthermore has the functionality to turn the interception part of the of extension on or off.
Since the current state is saved here too.

params.name: id
params.description: parameter for user's uuid (default = undefined)

properties.name: setAt
properties.description: Time at which we changed this status object

properties.name: offTill
properties.description:
Time until when the interception turned off,
less or equal to current time if interception is on

name: turnOn
description: Turn the interception back on

name: turnOff
description:
Turn interception off. The timer variable is for deciding whether we want to initiate a javascript timeout.
Which will automatically turn the interception back on after it stops. This nonly happens in the background, because
third party pages might close while the timer runs. Which makes the turning off and on of the interception go wrong.

params.name: timer
params.description: should we set a timer, for when to turn on? (true for background, false for other (third party) page)

name: turnOffFor
description: Turns extension off for the specified amount of minutes

params.name: minutes
params.description: amount of minutes that interception needs to be off

params.name: timer
params.description: should we set a timer, for when to turn on? (true for background, false for other (third party) page)

name: turnOffForDay
description: Turns interception off until 00:00:00 the next day.

params.name: timer
params.description: should we set a timer, for when to turn on? (true for background, false for other (third party) page)

name: turnExtensionBackOn
description: Turn the interception of the extension back on and update the storage to the new settingObject

name: setTimer
description: Run a timer until we need to turn interception back on

name: reInitTimer
description:
reInitialize the timer that turns interception back on, if there is need for this. Used for example when browser
is closed and re-opened.

params.name: settingsObject
params.description: SettingsObject to serialize

params.name: parsedSettingsObject
params.description: SettingsObject in object form, needs to be converted to instance of SettingsObject

params.name: serializedSettingsObject
params.description: Stringified SettingsObject to be deserialized

name: Distraction Shield/constants.js
zeeguuExLink
description: All the constants used throughout the extension

name: modes
description: Extension interception modes.

name: whitelist
description: A list of regexp's. If a url matches one of these it is not supposed to beblocked

name: logEventType
description: Logger event types.

name: logType
description: Log types.

name: Distraction Shield/contentInjection/inject.js
mainFlow
description: Check if we have come here after tds redirection, if not return, if so get mode and inject html.

name: initBasis
description: Initialize the tds info panel with the proper text based on mode

params.name: mode
params.description: used to set the text for the generalInfoText

name: extractDestination
description: This function extracts the original destination from a get parameter in the current url

unknown.tagValue:
{String} newUrl The url of the original destination plus a
get parameter indicating that the zeeguu exercise was completed. Should never return null!

return.description:
newUrl The url of the original destination plus a
get parameter indicating that the zeeguu exercise was completed. Should never return null!

params.name: modalContainer

params.name: staticModal

params.name: callback

name: initDataConsentButtons
description:
Inits the checkbox by retrieving the user's current choice on data collection.
adds an onchanged listener to the checkbox.

name: setDataCollection
description: Retrieves the current settings from storage, changes the data collection parameter and stores it.

params.name: bool
params.description: {boolean} the new value for the data collection parameter.

name: runIntroTour
description: Runs the intro tour in a new tab.

name: initAlarm
description: Starts the logger alarm. {@link logger}

name: initSession
description: function which fires upon starting the browser. Initiates the session.

name: Distraction Shield/introTour/introTour.js
Distraction Shield/modules/UUIDGenerator.js
generateUUID
description: Generates a UUID using the uuid npm package

name: Distraction Shield/modules/blockedSiteBuilder.js
createNewBlockedSite
description:
Constructs a new blockedSite instance using the given url, and passes it on using a promise
The only real right way of creating a new blocked site. For this it uses the BlockedSite and the urlFormatter.
It also adds it to the current list of blockedSites.

params.name: newUrl
params.description: the unformatted url of which to construct a BlockedSite

name: createBlockedSiteAndAddToStorage
description: constructs a new BlockedSite and instantly adds it to the storage as well

params.name: newUrl
params.description: the unformatted url of which to construct a BlockedSite

name: Distraction Shield/modules/browserutil.js
isOpenTab
description:
This function uses the chrome tabs api to see if a tab is open with a certain url.
Calls the callback with: the id of the tab if a tab is open with the given url, false otherwise

params.name: url
params.description: Url to check for

params.name: callback
params.description: Function to call with the result of the search

name: openTabSingleton
description:
A function that opens a tab with a given url, only if none is open yet,
switches to the already open tab otherwise

params.name: url
params.description: Url to check for

name: scrubFromHistory
description: This function removes (scrubs) all entries in browserhistory that contain the free-text string query

name: Distraction Shield/modules/dateutil.js
msToHHMMSS
description: Converts milliseconds to HH:MM:SS format

params.name: ms
params.description: amount of milliseconds

name: formatDate
description: Converts date object to string format

params.name: date
params.description: date object to format

name: getToday
description: returns the current date, formatted in the correct format.

name: Distraction Shield/modules/logger.js
logToFile
description: creates a log format "ID + args + on time"

params.name: event
params.description: {logEventType} describes the action performed

params.name: trigger
params.description: {string}  what triggered the event

params.name: value
params.description: value of event, default = null

params.name: type
params.description: {logType} type of the event (options, statistics ..)

name: scheduledLogDump
description:
This dumps the log from the storage to the server (if user gave permission?)
After that, it clears the logs.

name: dumpToFile
description: This function dumps the array of logs in a logfile containing the date & logs.

name: getUUID
description: retrieves UUID from userSettings

name: storeLog
description: Append new log to existing log.

name: sendLogsTo
description: Sends current log file to dst

params.name: data
params.description: formatted data to be sent

name: Distraction Shield/modules/statistics/Tracker.js
constructor
description:
The tracker tracks whether you are currently working on exercises.
Every second, the "alarm" is fired, and the url of the current tab is examined.
If this url corresponds with the zeeguu url, the time spent on exercises counter is incremented.

name: getCurrentTab
description: gets the current tab

name: init
description: Initialize the alarm, and initialize the idle-checker.

name: triggerUpdateTime
description:
This function is called everytime the time spent on exercises or
on a blocked site needs to be updated.
This occurs when the trackerAlarm fires, the idleState is updated,
the active tab is changed, or the tab is updated.

name: createTrackerAlarm
description: Creates the tracker alarm which fires every x minutes. x defined by constants.trackerAlarmFrequency

name: updateIdleState
description:
Function which updates the idle state. If the user goes idle, triggerUpdateTime is fired, and the
trackerAlarm is removed.
If the user becomes active again, the triggerUpdateTime is fired,
and the trackerAlarm is created again.

params.name: idleState
params.description: state received from the idleListener

name: addIdleListener
description: Adds a idleListener to the background to detect whether a user is idle or not.

name: addAlarmListener
description:
Adds an alarmListener to listen for the trackerAlarm. Every time the alarm ticks, the triggerUpdateTime
method is fired.

name: addOnActiveTabChangeListener
description: Adds an onActiveTabChangeListener. When a tab becomes active, the triggerUpdateTime method is called.

name: addOnTabUpdateListener
description: Adds an onTabUpdateListener. When a tab updates(e.g. a new address is filled in), the triggerUpdateTime method is called.

name: handleStorageChange
description: Handles the changes received from the storageOnChangedListener.

params.name: changes
params.description: received from the storageOnChangedListener.

name: retrieveTimeSpent
description: Get a list of the time wasted on all BlockedSites from the BlockedSiteList

name: putBackTimeSpent
description:
Puts the timeValues previously extracted using the retrieveTimeSpent method back in to the
{@link Tracker#blockedsites} field.

name: getBlockedSites
description: adds the BlockedSiteList from the storage to {@link Tracker#blockedsites}.

name: incTimeExercises
description: Increments the time spent on exercises using the exerciseTime module.

params.name: timeSpent
params.description: the amount by which the time spent should be incremented.

name: incTimeBlockedSite
description: Increments the timeSpent for the blockedSite inputted.

params.name: site
params.description: the blockedSite of which the timeSpent should be incremented.

params.name: timeSpent
params.description: the amount by which the time spent should be incremented.

name: matchToBlockedSites
description: Matches the inputted tab to the blocked sites.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} resolves to the matched blockedSite. Rejects if there is no match.

return.description: resolves to the matched blockedSite. Rejects if there is no match.

name: compareDomain
description: Compares the domain of an url to another domain using a regex.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} containing whether the domain-regex matches the url.

params.name: url
params.description: Url to be compared.

params.name: domain
params.description: Domain of which a regex is created.

return.description: containing whether the domain-regex matches the url.

name: createRegexFromDomain
description: Creates a regex string which using the domain of an url.

params.name: domain
params.description: of which a regex should be created.

name: compareUrlToRegex
description: Compare regex to url.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} Returns true if the url matches the regex. False if they do not match.

return.description: Returns true if the url matches the regex. False if they do not match.

name: Distraction Shield/modules/statistics/exerciseTime.js
incrementTodayExerciseTime
description:
Increments the counter for time spent on exercises today with 'amount'.
When there the current day does not exist in the storage yet, initialize the counter for this day at 0.

params.name: amount
params.description: the amount of seconds to be added to the current date

name: Distraction Shield/modules/statistics/interception.js
calcInterceptData
description:
This method goes through the interceptDateList and count how many times the user was intercepted last day,
last week, last month and the total amount of interceptions.

params.name: dateList
params.description: the total list with all interceptions on the different days

name: incrementInterceptionCounter
description:
Receives the url from the parameter, and searches the correct blockedSite item from the blockedsite list.
Then the interceptioncounter for this item is incremented by 1.
Also the global interceptioncounter is incremented by one.

params.name: urlAddress
params.description: the url to be compared with the blockedsite list to find the correct item to be incremented

name: addToInterceptDateList
description: Adds the current time+date to the saved time+date list

name: Distraction Shield/modules/storage/StorageListener.js
constructor
description:
Adds a listener which listens for changes in the storage. Page that use data from the storage and need
to be updated on change, will implement a function that defines what to do with the changes and pass
it on to the constructor of this class. This method will then fire upon the change of storage.

params.name: handleStorageChange
params.description: The function to fired that takes as parameter the data from the onChanged event

name: Distraction Shield/modules/storage/storage.js
setStorage
description: used to set items stored in the storage of the chrome api. Returns a promise

params.name: dataKey
params.description: key of the data to store

params.name: dataValue
params.description: value of data to store

params.name: isLocal
params.description: used to distinguish between using local or sync storage (default sync)

name: getStorage
description: used to retrieve items stored from the storage of the chrome api. Returns a promise due to asynchronousness

params.name: dataKey
params.description: key of the data to store

params.name: isLocal
params.description: used to distinguish between using local or sync storage (default sync)

name: getAll
description: Gets everything TDS stores from the storage. Also parses all data that needs to be deserialized.

params.name: callback
params.description: function that takes the result of this get as parameter

name: getAllUnParsed
description: Gets everything TDS stores from the storage. This does not parse any data that needs to be deserialized.

params.name: callback
params.description: function that takes the result of this get as parameter

name: getBlacklist
description: Gets the {@link BlockedSiteList} from the storage and parses it, before passing it on to the callback

params.name: callback
params.description: function that takes the result of this get as parameter

name: getBlacklistPromise
description: Gets a promise to the @link BlockedSiteList in the storage

name: setBlacklist
description: Serializes and then sets the {@link BlockedSiteList} in the storage.

params.name: blockedSiteList
params.description: function that takes the result of this get as parameter

name: getSettings
description: Gets the {@link UserSettings} from the storage and parses it, before passing it on to the callback

params.name: callback
params.description: function that takes the result of this get as parameter

name: getSettingsUnParsed
description: Gets an unparsed version of the {@link UserSettings} from the storage

params.name: callback
params.description: function that takes this unparsed output

name: setSettings
description: Serializes and then sets the {@link UserSettings} in the storage.

params.name: settingsObject
params.description: The object we want to set in the storage

name: setSettingsWithCallback
description: Serializes and then sets the {@link UserSettings} in the storage, after this it calls the callback function.

params.name: settingsObject
params.description: The object we want to set in the storage

params.name: callback
params.description: the function to be called once we return

name: getMode
description: Gets the current mode in the settings from the storage.

params.name: callback
params.description: function to be called that takes the mode as parameter

name: getInterceptCounter
description: Gets the current interceptCount from the storage.

name: setInterceptCounter
description: Sets the interceptCounter to a new value

params.name: number
params.description: the new value of the counter

name: getInterceptDateList
description: Gets the current InterceptDatelist.

name: setInterceptDateList
description: Sets the current dateList in the storage

params.name: dateList
params.description: the new value of the dateList to be set

name: getExerciseTimeList
description: Gets the ExerciseTime array from the storage

name: setExerciseTimeList
description: Sets the exerciseTime array into the storage

params.name: statList
params.description: the new value of the exerciseTime array

name: getLogs
description: Gets the logs from the storage and passes it on to the callback

params.name: callback
params.description: takes the logs once we get them from the storage

name: setLogs
description: Sets the logs in the storage

params.name: logs
params.description: the logs to be stored in local.storage

name: clearLogs
description: Removes all the logs from the storage. This is run after we update the logfile in chrome.local.storage

name: setLogFile
description: Sets the logfile into the storage

params.name: data
params.description: the logfile to be stored in loca.storage

name: handleRuntimeError
description: Checks for a runtime error.

name: Distraction Shield/modules/storage/storageModifier.js

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} Promise that is either resolved or rejected. If rejected passes the type of error. (catch with Promise.catch)

params.name: blocked_site

Used in the BlockedSiteBuilder

params.name: onSuccess

params.description:
the callback function that when we encounter an error during the asynchronous request. This results in rejecting the promise
fire asynchronous get request to find the end port of the passed url

params.name: xmlHttp

params.name: onSuccess
params.description: the callback function that takes the newly formatted end-url together with it's page title as argument. This results in resolving the promise

params.name: onFailure
params.description:
the callback function that when we encounter an error during the asynchronous request. This results in rejecting the promise
function to be passed to the get-request

name: errorHandler

name: Distraction Shield/optionsPage/classes/BlacklistTable.js
BlacklistTable
description:
The table holding the blockedSites and all of its functionality.
Every row has the corresponding BlockedSite Object attached to it in order to have easy acces and manipulation.

params.name: html_element
params.description: the <.table> element to which we connect this BlacklistTable

name: addToTable
description: append html table-row to the table

name: addToTableWithFadeIn
description: applies fadeIn effect to the adding of the table row

name: removeAllFromTable
description: removes all rows from the table

name: render
description: this function removes all table rows, compares the old list with the new list and adds all and fades in new elements.

params.name: newList
params.description: {BlockedSiteList} the new list of blockedsites

params.name: oldList
params.description: {BlockedSiteList} the old list of blockedsites

name: setCheckboxFunction
description: set functionality for all checkboxes found in every table_row

name: setDeleteButtonFunction
description: If a delete button is clicked, the closest tr element is deleted.

name: generateTableRow
description: Takes a BlockedSiteObject and constructs a table row from it, together with attaching this item to the row.

unknown.tagValue: Table row to be inserted into the table.

params.name: blockedSite
params.description: the item for which we want to construct a TableRow

return.description: Table row to be inserted into the table.

name: Distraction Shield/optionsPage/classes/GreenToRedSlider.js
GreenToRedSlider
description:
class that connects a <.div> with a span and slider together with all the functionality. I.E. changing colour, updating eachother's values and functionality to be added to the html_elements. The structure this class wants to receive is: 
     <.div id=sliderID>, holding all other components
         <.input type=range id=sliderID + "-range">
         <.span id=sliderID + "-value">
     <./div>

params.name: sliderID
params.description: {string} The ID of the sliderDiv

params.name: saveFunction
params.description: {function} The function that takes the newly updated value and does what is supposed to happen with it

name: setOnEventFunc
description: sets all event functions for the GreenToRedSlider

name: updateColor
description: Update the colour of the slider according to the inputValue

name: setValue
description: sets the updated value to all elements

params.name: val
params.description: the new value

name: calculateHours
description: formats a value in minutes to Hours and minutes.

params.name: val
params.description: the value to be formatted

name: checkTimeValidity
description: function that checks the validity of the value inputted in the editable span

params.name: val
params.description: string value that was inputted that needs to be checked whether correct

name: timeInputError
description: error function to be fired when we fail the checkTimeValidity function

params.name: val
params.description: string value that was inputted that needs to be checked whether correct

name: Distraction Shield/optionsPage/classes/IntervalSlider.js
IntervalSlider
description:
Class that subclasses the GreenToRedSlider to a single purpose. This class updates the interceptionInterval
of the user's settings.

params.name: sliderID
params.description: {string} The ID of the sliderDiv

name: Distraction Shield/optionsPage/classes/TurnOffSlider.js
TurnOffSlider
description:
Subclass of the GreenToRedSlider, this also connects a button to the set of html_elements.
Furthermore it connects a userSettings item and fires functions according to the values of the
html_elements in order to manipulate the settings and let the user specify what he/she wants from the extension
Specifically turning the interception off or back on for a given amount of time

params.name: sliderID
params.description: {string} The ID of the sliderDiv

name: init
description: Initializer function for a TurnOffSlider

name: toggleShowOffMessage
description: Create the right type of message or slider to be shown next to the turn off/on button.

params.name: settings_object
params.description: the {@link UserSettings} on which we decide what to show

name: formatDate
description: Format a Date object to the correct displayable version

name: createMessage
description: Function that overrides the {@link GreenToRedSlider} function

params.name: val
params.description: the value of the slider

name: createOffMessage
description: Create the right type of message or slider to be shown next to the turn off/on button.

params.name: settings_object
params.description: the {@link UserSettings} that we use to generate the TurnOffMessage

name: updateSettings
description: Updater function that updates the slider with the new {@link UserSettings}

params.name: userSettings
params.description: the {@link UserSettings} on which we want the slider to update

name: offButtonFunc
description: The function to be fired when we hit the TurnOff/On button

name: addStorageListener
description: Adds the right storage listener to this object

name: Distraction Shield/optionsPage/connectDataToHtml.js
loadHtmlBlacklist

name: reloadHtmlBlacklist

connectButton

name: initModeSelection
description: enables the user to update the mode of the extension and that these settings are synched across the entire extension

params.name: buttonGroup

name: Distraction Shield/optionsPage/options.js
modeGroup

name: initOptionsPage
description: Initial function that is fired when the page is loaded. It initialize HTML elements and set the local variables

name: connectHtmlFunctionality
description: connect the functionality to the different html_elements on the optionspage.

name: connectStorageDataToHtml
description: connect the data found in the storage to the html_elements on the page

params.name: storage_output

description: reloads the BlockedSiteList in the BlacklistTable by comparing it to the old value

name: restartTour

name: openStatisticsPage
description: opens up the page with user statistics

This function loads the button functionality for the modal. This can only be loaded when the modal is shown,
since the html is added dynamically

name: Distraction Shield/statisticsPage/statistics.js
interceptionCounterTable
description:
This file contains the code and functions which control the statistics page.
Data is retrieved from the storage, and is passed to various tables.

name: initStatisticsPage
description:
Initialize HTML elements and set the data in the tables. Retrieves the data from the storage using Promises.
Waits until all data is retrieved, and then populates the interceptionCounterTable, the blacklistTable and the
exerciseTimeTable.

name: connectHtmlFunctionality
description: Connects HTML functionality to javascript classes

connectButtons

name: openStatisticsPage

name: openOptionsPage
description: Opens options page and closes tooltip

description: match the current url to the current list of blockedSiteItems

params.name: url
params.description: to be compared

params.name: callback
params.description: function that takes the blockedSite to which the url was found to be equal to

name: toggleBlockedSite
description: returns a function that gets the corresponding BlockedSite from the background and updates its checkboxVal to the new value.

params.name: url
params.description: of the current page

name: setSaveButton
description: Changes the text of {@link saveButton} to Block/Unblock

params.name: blocked
params.description: {boolean} true = 'Block', false = 'Unblock'

name: setSaveButtonToSuccess
description: Change colour and update functionality of {@link saveButton} when we add a new website to the blockedSiteList

name: setSaveButtonFunctionality
description:
Update the functionality of {@see saveButton} to one of 3 states:
  • 1. Add a non-blacklisted website to the blacklist/blockedSiteList
  • 2. Disable the blocking of this blacklisted website
  • 3. Enable the blocking of this blacklisted website
